summary.para: Creates a new array node in a multi-value property.

param.name: pszArrayName
param.para: Specifies the top-level property for which to create a new node.

param.name: fAppend
param.para: TRUE for insert after, FALSE for insert before.

param.name: pszNewArrayElementName
param.para: Specifies a user-allocated buffer to store the new array element name.

param.name: cchNewArrayElementName
param.para: Specifies an allocated buffer size in characters.

param.name: pdwcchNewArrayElementNameRequired
param.para: On failure, contains the required size for pszNewArrayElementName.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: New node is created and name is in pszNewArrayElementName.
Macro HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND) returned when array name is invalid.

Macro HRESULT_FROM_WIN32(ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER) returned when pszNewArrayElementName is not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in pdwcchNewArrayElementNameRequired.

remarks.para: Note The first element of an existing set is at index 1.
To create a pszArrayName at toplevel/secondlevel[1], call this function with pszArrayName == toplevel, fAppend=FALSE.
To create an array node that is an extension at [namespace]toplevel/secondlevel[1], call this function with pszArrayName == [namespace:secondlevel]toplevel.
To append to the set, pass fAppend=TRUE instead; pszNewArrayElementName then contains the resulting array node name, including the index.

summary.para: Deletes the data at a specified array entry.

param.name: pszArrayElementName
param.para: Specifies array entry from which to remove all data.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Node is deleted.
Property name doesn't exist for delete.

remarks.para: Note Element indexes are unchanged for the entire set. Array node element ID, modification and version data can still be enumerated with IContactPropertyCollection.

summary.para: Deletes the labels at a specified array entry.

param.name: pszArrayElementName
param.para: Specifies the property to delete labels on.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Labels deleted successfully.
Property name doesn't exist for delete.

summary.para: Deletes the value at a specified property. Property modification and version data can still be enumerated with IContactPropertyCollection.

param.name: pszPropertyName
param.para: Specifies the property to delete the value for.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Property deleted successfully.
Property name doesn't exist for delete.

summary.para: Retrieves the binary data of a property using an .

param.name: pszContentType
param.para: Specifies user-allocated buffer to store the MIME content type.

param.name: cchContentType
param.para: Specifies the allocated buffer size in characters.

param.name: pdwcchContentTypeRequired
param.para: On failure, contains the required size for pszContentType.

param.name: ppStream
param.para: On success, contains a new . Use this to retrieve the binary data.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

item.description: ppStream contains an . Caller must release the reference.

description.para: No data for this value. Either the property has been present in the past but its value has been removed or the property is a container of other properties (toplevel/secondlevel[3]). The buffer at pszContentType has been zeroed.
No data found for this property name.
Unable to get value for this property due to schema.

item.description: pszContentType was not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in pdwcchContentTypeRequired.

remarks.para: To retrieve a single level property, set pszPropertyName to the property name.

To retrieve a value from a multi-value (hierarchical) property, include the desired index as part of pszPropertyName using the form: toplevel/secondlevel[1]/thirdlevel. NOTE: the first element of a set is index 1, so index [0] is invalid.
For deleted properties, this method returns S_OK and an of zero length. NOTE: For properties not of binary type, this method may return incorrect data in the IStream.

summary.para: Retrieves the date and time value at a specified property into a caller's structure. All times are stored and returned as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: The property has been present in the past but its value has been removed. The has been zeroed.
No data found for this property name.

remarks.para: To retrieve a single level property, set pszPropertyName to the property name.

To retrieve a value from a multi-value (hierarchical) property, include the desired index as part of pszPropertyName using the form: toplevel/secondlevel[1]/thirdlevel. NOTE: the first element of a set is index 1, so index [0] is invalid.

summary.para: Retrieves the labels for a specified array element name.

param.name: pszLabels
param.para: Specifies user-allocated buffer to store the labels.

param.name: cchLabels
param.para: Specifies allocated buffer size in characters.

param.name: pdwcchLabelsRequired
param.para: On failure, contains the required size for pszLabels.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Retrieval successful.
No data found for this property name.
Unable to get value for this property due to schema.

item.description: pszLabels was not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in *pdwcchLabelsRequired.

remarks.para: The user-allocated buffer in pszLabels receives a concatenated list of null-terminated strings, followed by an empty string. In other words, the last 4 bytes will be zero. For example, L"str1\0str2\0\0". NOTE: Succeeds only for multi-value properties. Also, may return labels in a different order than they were set.

summary.para: Returns an IContactPropertyCollection for the current contact. Optionally, filters the IContactPropertyCollection to enumerate only some values.

param.name: ppPropertyCollection
param.para: On success, points to the new IContactPropertyCollection.

param.name: pszMultiValueName
param.para: Specifies the name of the collection (for example: emailAddresses or [namespace]arrayNode). If NULL, all collections are searched for ppszLabels.

param.name: dwLabelCount
param.para: Specifies the number of labels in ppszLabels. If zero, all subproperties with labels are returned.

param.name: ppszLabels
param.para: Specifies an array of string labels to test for. All labels in the array must be set to a valid string (not NULL).

param.name: fAnyLabelMatches
param.para: TRUE if the presence of any label on a given property matches the property. FALSE if all labels must be present to match the property.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Always returns success.

remarks.para: Caller can enumerate all child properties of a top-level property with an optional label filter applied. For example: all emailAddresses where label="work". On success, collection has been reset to the location before the first element (if any are present). Call Next to begin querying data.

summary.para: Retrieves the string value at a specified property into a caller-allocated buffer.

param.name: pszValue
param.para: Specifies user-allocated buffer to store the property.

param.name: cchValue
param.para: Specifies allocated buffer size in characters.

param.name: pdwcchPropertyValueRequired
param.para: On failure, contains the required size for pszValue.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: No data for this value. Either the property has been present in the past but its value has been removed or the property is a container of other properties (toplevel/secondlevel[3]). The buffer at pszValue has been zeroed.
No data found for this property name.

item.description: pszValue was not large enough to store the value. The required buffer size is stored in *pdwcchPropertyValueRequired.

remarks.para: To retrieve a single level property, set pszPropertyName to the property name.

To retrieve a value from a multi-value (hierarchical) property, include the desired index as part of pszPropertyName in the form: toplevel/secondlevel[1]/thirdlevel. NOTE: the first element of a set is index 1, so index [0] is invalid. The following example retrieves the Title of the fourth Name property of a contact.

summary.para: Sets the binary data at a specified property to the contents of a specified , which contains a null-terminated string (as MIME type) data.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: CGD_DEFAULT can be used to create or overwrite the value at pszPropertyName.

param.name: pszContentType
param.para: Specifies null-terminated string representing MIME type to store when CGD_DEFAULT.

param.name: pStream
param.para: Pointer to object containing data to place at this node. NOTE: IStream.Read is called for the data until it succeeds with a zero-length read. Any other return value results in a failure and no change.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Value is set successfully.
Property name is invalid for set, or property name doesn't exist for delete.
Unable to set the value for this property due to schema.

remarks.para: To set a single-level property, set pszPropertyName to the property name.
To set a property from a multi-value property, set pszPropertyName

summary.para: Sets the date and time value at a specified property to a given . All times are stored and returned as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: CGD_DEFAULT can be used to create or overwrite value at pszPropertyName.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Value is set at this property.
Property name invalid for set.
Unable to set the value for this property due to schema.

summary.para: Appends the set of labels passed in to the specified property's label set. Note: This method does not check for duplicate labels.

param.name: dwLabelCount
param.para: Specifies the count of labels in array.

param.name: ppszLabels
param.para: Specifies an array of LPCWSTR labels.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Labels set successfully.
No data found for this property name.
Unable to set value for this property due to schema.

summary.para: Sets the string value of a specified property to that of a specified null-terminated string.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: CGD_DEFAULT can be used to create or overwrite value at pszPropertyName.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values:

description.para: Value is set at this property.
Property name invalid for set.
Unable to set value for this property due to schema.

remarks.para: To set a single-level property, set pszPropertyName to the property name.
To set a property from a multi-value property, set pszPropertyName to the form: toplevel/secondlevel[4]/thirdlevel.

summary.para: Do not use. Used to retrieve, set, create, and remove properties on an IContact. Property names and extension mechanisms are described in icontactproperties.h.
